defs: = ಸ್ವಾತಿಮಳೆ.
= ಸ್ವಾತಿಮಳೆ.
a contemplating, pondering on the Self, the spiritual part of oneself.
analysis of one's own personality without the help of another; a self-analysis.
the act of tasting (a food or beverage).
taste; flavour; savour.
the quality that gives a sense of enjoyment to a person.
liking; fondness; inclination.
the act of flavouring (something) to make (it) enjoyable or more enjoyable.
the experience caused or mood created in a reader of literary work, listener of music or spectator in a theatre, by the emotional character of the the situation.
that tastes good; flavorful; savory; tasty; delicious.
a tasty, delicious thing.
very tasty; very delicious.
to test the flavor of by putting a little in one's mouth; to taste.
to relish or delight in something which is enjoyable; to enjoy.
good-tasting; savory; delicious, delectable.
delightfull; lovable; appealing.
beautiful; charming; lovely.
taste; palatableness; delicacy.
beauty; loveliness; charm.
grapes.
good and tasty food.
anything that is tasty or palatable.
a thick, usu. dark-brown syrup produced during the refining of sugar; molasses.
a particular perfume or fragrant substance.

any spirituous liquor.
the plant Asparagus racemosus of Liliaceae family; climbing asparagus.
grapes.
grapes.
one's office, authority or duty.
freedom from control, influence, support, aid or the like, of others.
one of the mystical circle of the body in the umbilical region.
not being under another's control; independent; free.
having control over.
a controlling; the fact of having another or something under one's control.
a free, independent man.
the condition of being under one's own control or possession.
a woman who has full control over her husband.

a studying, esp. the vedas, on one's own (without taking help or guidance from others).

a sound; a noise.

personal experience.

a realisation of an esoteric truth.

present by virtue of nature; innate; not acquired; natural.

normal or usual; in the ordinary course of events; natural.
customarily expected or accepted; natural.
free from affectation or artificiality.
that which is natural.

a god.
a ruler; a king.
a man as he is related to his wife; husband.

a respectful mode of addressing men or used in the solutation in a letter.

the state or fact of being a king, lord, master, employer or owner; kingship; lordship.
legal right of possession; proprietorship; ownership.

a woman as is related to her husband; a wife.
the quality, state or an instance of being loyal; faithfulness or faithful adherence to one's master; loyalty.

the fact of having and controlling property; the relation of an owner to the thing possessed; possession with the right to transfer possession to others; the state or fact of being an owner; ownership.
anything that is legally owned.
the exclusive right granted to produce, sell or get profit from an invention, process, etc. for a specific number of years; patent.

name of one of the twenty eight Śaivaāgamas.
a kind of vīṇe (a stringed musical isntrument).
a realisation of an esoteric truth.

having self-government or functioning independently without control by others; autonomous.

the fact or condition of being autonomous; self-government; independence; autonomy.

that which is pleasant, delightful or charming.
a feeling of intentness, concern or curiosity about something; interest.
excellence; eminence; superiority.

gain or benefit (in gen.).
one's own money.
the tendency of being selfish; selfishness.

of or belonging to oneself, one's family or one's kinsmen, etc.

a man acting according to one's own will without heeding to others' advice and deliberately disregarding others' interest.
a man who indulges in debauchery; a dissipated man.

a horse.
a male buffalo.
name of one of the Upanishads.
one of the five classifications of men, based on their height; a class of men of eight feet high, according to Varāhamihira.
name of a mountain.
an anklet with a series of small jingling bells.

a maxim of swan and milk, used to denote that wise people consider and appreciate only the good and possitive points of something and never engage in fault-finding and condemning it for the blemishes it has.
the stately gait of swans.
(pros.) a metrical verse of four lines each having seven groups of three syllables followed by a short syllable and a long syllable (uuu, u-u, u-u, u-u, u-u, u-u, u-u, u, - ).
= ಹಂಸವಾಹನೆ.
a woman whose gait resembles the stately gait of a swan.
the last notable creative work, musical concert, etc. of a person before retirement or death; the farewell work or song; swan-song.
the slender, gracious neck of a swan.
anything resembling this.

the tender downs of swans.
a bed, mattress made of the tender downs of swans.
= ಹಂಸತೂಲತಲ್ಪ.
= ಹಂಸತೂಲತಲ್ಪ.
= ಹಂಸತೂಲ.
= ಹಂಸತೂಲತಲ್ಪ.
the state of being Brahma.
the fabled sweet song sung by a swan before its death; swan-song.
(mus.) in Karnāṭaka system, a rāga (musical mode) derived from the main mode Dhīraśankarābharaṇa.
an abrasive paper quoted with pulverised glass and used like a sand-paper; a glass-paper.
= ಹಂಸಪಾದ - 1.
(pros.) a metrical verse having four lines each having eight groups of three syllables each followed by one long syllable (uuu, uuu, uuu, uuu, uu-, -uu, -uu, -uu, -).

the foot of a swan.
a mark (^) used to denote insertion of a word or letter in writing or correcting proof; caret.

the vine Cissus pedata of Vitaceae family; Iguana's foot vine.
the plant Coldenia procumbens of Boraginaceae family.
a kind of tree.
a kind of plant.
a kind of dance performed together by sixteen people.
the esoteric hymn for meditating on the Supreme Being.
(pros.) a metrical verse having four lines each having four groups of three syllables each (-uu, -uu, -u-, u--).

the long-necked, web-footed goose, Anser indicus of Anatidae family, with white head that has a black stripe, noted for its ability to fly over a height of 18,000 ft; a bar-headed goose.

the soft, low-toned sound made by swans.
Brahma, whose vehicle is a swan.

a particular kind of military array, arranged in the battle-field.
a tax levied on a land converted for agriculural purpose.
a kind of sari (a garment worn by Indian women, consisting of a long piece of cotton or silk wrapped around the body with one end draped over the head or over one shoulder).
a female swan.
name of a plant.
the quality of being pure; freedom from sin, evil or other corrupting elements.
a transgression of moral, ethical rules or short coming from the point of view of religion; a sin.
a moral, ethical or religious transgression; a sinful act.
a man of low quality; a useless or unworthy fellow.
having not been divided, separated into parts; not broken; whole; total.

to be shaking; to be moving unsteadily.
